Quick search

Module: preflag¶

class apercal.modules.preflag.preflag(filename=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Preflagging class. Used to automatically flag data and apply preknown flags.

aoflagger()[source]¶

Runs aoflagger on the datasets with the strategies given in the config-file. Creates and applies a preliminary bandpass before executing the strategy for better performance of the flagging routines. Strategies for calibrators and target fields normally differ.

aoflagger_bandpass()[source]¶

Creates a bandpass from a known frequency behaviour of the telescope. This is usually applied on the fly when using aoflagger.

aoflagger_flag()[source]¶

Uses the aoflagger to flag the calibrators and the target data set(s). Uses the bandpass corrected visibilities if bandpass was derived and applied successfully beforehand.

aoflagger_plot(mspath, baselines=[(0, 11), (2, 7), (4, 5)])[source]¶

Saves a png with the flags that AOFlagger added for some ‘typical’ baselines Will save in the same directory as the measurement set

Args:

mspath (str): full path to the measurement set that has been flagged baselines (List[Tuple[int]]): baselines for which to produce the plots. These are

antenna number in the MS (typically 0 means RT2).
edges()[source]¶

Flag the edges of the subbands

ghosts()[source]¶

Flag the ghosts of each subband at channel 16 and 48

go()[source]¶

Executes the complete preflag step with the parameters indicated in the config-file in the following order: shadow edges ghosts manualflag aoflagger

manualflag()[source]¶

Use drivecasa and the CASA task flagdata to flag entire antennas, baselines, correlations etc. before doing any other calibration.

manualflag_antenna()[source]¶

Function to flag complete antennas Antennas are named by their antenna names (e.g. ‘RT2,RT3’)

manualflag_auto()[source]¶

Function to flag the auto-correlations

manualflag_baseline()[source]¶

Function to flag complete baselines Use antenna names and the notation ‘ant1&ant2;ant3&ant4’ etc.

manualflag_channel()[source]¶

Function to flag individual channels and channel ranges Use the CASA notation e.g. ‘0~5;120~128’. You don’t need to give a ‘0:’ for the spw. It’s added automatically.

manualflag_clipzeros()[source]¶

Function to flag any zero-valued data

manualflag_corr()[source]¶

Function to flag complete correlations Possible values are ‘XX,XY,YX,YY’

manualflag_from_file()[source]¶

Function to flag based on commands from a file

This provides a way to input more complex flagging commands.

manualflag_time()[source]¶

Function to flag time ranges Use the CASA notation e.g. ‘09:14:0~09:54:0’.

reset()[source]¶

Function to reset the current step and remove all generated data. Be careful! Deletes all data generated in this step!

reset_all()[source]¶

Function to reset the current step and remove all generated data. Be careful! Deletes all data generated in this step!

shadow()[source]¶

Flag all data sets for shadowed antennas using drivecasa and the CASA task flagdata

summary()[source]¶

Creates a general summary of the parameters in the parameter file generated during PREFLAG. No detailed summary is available for PREFLAG

returns (DataFrame): A python pandas dataframe object, which can be looked at with the style function in the notebook
